decks.notes: The deck focuses on using powerful control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building towards a win condition with Nicol Bolas planeswalkers. By utilizing cards like Though Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to control the game's pace and deny the opponent resources. The inclusion of powerful removal spells like Bedevil and Ritual of Soot helps maintain board control, while Enter the God-Eternals provides a strong tempo swing. The deck seeks to grind out the opponent's resources and establish dominance with the high-value planeswalker cards.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Wilderness Reclamation to generate a large amount of mana and constantly cast Nexus of Fate to take extra turns, while also using cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to control the battlefield and ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The deck focuses on creating a repetitive loop of casting Nexus of Fate, taking extra turns, and building up resources to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and board control.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a late-game win condition with powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God and Liliana, Dreadhorde General. The deck includes plenty of removal options like Bedevil and Ritual of Soot to keep the board clear, combined with hand disruption cards like Though Erasure to disrupt the opponent's plans. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent with efficient threats, the deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and powerful planeswalkers to dominate the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining counterspells like Absorb and Dovin's Veto with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from establishing a strong presence. The inclusion of card draw spells like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta help to ensure a steady stream of resources, while powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Liliana, Dreadhorde General can quickly close out the game.

This Aggro - Weenie White deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with small, efficient creatures and using cards like Conclave Tribunal and Gideon Blackblade to maintain control and push for damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of threats that can quickly grow out of hand with cards like History of Benalia and Venerated Loxodon, while also providing protection and disruption with cards like Adanto Vanguard and Tithe Taker. The mana base is streamlined to ensure that the deck can consistently hit its curve and pressure the opponent early.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Liliana, Dreadhorde General. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like God-Eternal Kefnet and Enter the God-Eternals to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently crippled. The mana base is designed to support the control spells and allow for consistent casting of the deck's powerful threats.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By combining efficient creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Footlight Fiend with powerful cards like Judith, the Scourge Diva and Fireblade Artist, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord provides additional reach and utility, while cards like Heroic Reinforcements and Mortify offer flexibility and removal options. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive strategy and ensure consistent casting of its spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker and Adanto Vanguard. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Rage and Shock to remove threats from the opponent's side of the board while utilizing cards like Tenth District Legionnaire and Feather, the Redeemed to keep the pressure on. The inclusion of cards like Samut's Sprint and Defiant Strike help to pump up your creatures and push for lethal damage. With a strong mana base and a solid curve, Naya Aggro is designed to strike fast and hard.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with cards like Absorb and Dovin's Veto to counter opponent's threats. The deck also includes board wipes such as Kaya's Wrath to clear the board and gain control. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and card selection spells like Chemister's Insight and Thought Erasure to help maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to manipulate the board and generate card advantage, along with spells like Mortify and Kaya's Wrath to deal with threats, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan and eventually overpower them through cards like Ugin, the Ineffable and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The mana base is built to support the Esper colors and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers. By disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure and Mortify, while also maintaining card advantage with Chemister's Insight, you can eventually overwhelm them with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Chromium, the Mutable. The lands in the deck are carefully chosen to ensure consistent mana fixing, allowing you to play your spells on curve and stay ahead in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card advantage. By using cards like Thought Erasure and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's plans, along with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Liliana, Dreadhorde General, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. With a strong mana base and a variety of answers to threats, this deck is designed to grind out wins by controlling the pace of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Duress and Thought Erasure, while also eliminating threats on the board with removal spells like Cast Down and Bedevil. The planeswalkers in the deck provide additional value and card advantage, allowing the player to dominate the game and secure victory. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements for its spells and planeswalkers.

The deck focuses on utilizing Wilderness Reclamation and Nexus of Fate to create infinite turns, allowing the player to draw cards, control the board, and eventually win the game through card advantage and outlasting the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional ways to manipulate the game and protect the combo. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish the combo and overwhelm the opponent with continuous turns and resource advantage.

This Selesnya Aggro deck relies on a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 match. Key cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Merfolk Branchwalker help to ramp up the board early on, while cards like God-Eternal Oketra and Lyra Dawnbringer provide strong late-game threats. With a mix of mana ramp and disruptive spells like Conclave Tribunal, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Hostage Taker to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes a mix of removal spells and powerful planeswalkers like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vivien Reid to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck also incorporates Explore creatures like Merfolk Branchwalker and Jadelight Ranger to dig through the deck and ensure consistent land drops. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruption while maintaining card advantage and board presence.
